Package fr.cnrs.iees.omugi.properties

package fr.cnrs.iees.omugi.properties

Interfaces for lists of attributes associated to graph elements (nodes and edges). An attribute is called a property here and is represented when needed by the Property class.

Conceptually, all property lists are lists of (key,value) pairs, where key is any String identifier unique within the scope of the list, and value is any primitive type or Object sub-class instance.

Implementation classes (names ending with the "Impl" suffix) should not be manipulated directly, but rather through their multiple interfaces which isolate different specific behaviours:

  • for immutable properties, use ReadOnlyPropertyList;
  • for property lists that can shrink or grow (i.e. non fixed list), use ExtendablePropertyList;
  • for read-write, fixed-size property lists, use SimplePropertyList.

We provide six implementations of these interfaces which differ in their construction and in the way they store the data. Of course, this list can be extended as needed.

Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 19 ao√ªt 2021
  • Interface Summary
    Interface
    Description
    ExtendablePropertyList
    A mutable SimplePropertyList, i.e.
    PropertyListFactory
    A factory for property lists.
    PropertyListGetters
    This interface isolates the generic getters for properties.
    PropertyListSetters
    This interface isolates the generic setters for properties.
    ReadOnlyPropertyList
    A read-only property list, ie with getters but no setters.
    ResizeablePropertyList
    This interface contains the methods required to make a property list extendable.
    SimplePropertyList
    Simple, straightforward read-write property list.
    SimpleWriteProtectablePropertyList
    A SimplePropertyList list that can be made read-only on demand.
